item.title: Monoidal bicategories, differential linear logic, and analytic functors
item.description: arXiv:2405.05774v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We develop further the theory of monoidal bicategories by introducing and studying bicate- gorical counterparts of the notions of a linear explonential comonad, as considered in the study of linear logic, and of a codereliction transformation, introduced to study differential linear logic via differential categories. As an application, we extend the differential calculus of Joyal's analytic functors to analytic functors between presheaf categories, just as ordinary calculus extends from a single variable to many variables.
item.dc:creator: M. Fiore, N. Gambino, M. Hyland

item.title: Exact categories of topological vector spaces with linear topology
item.description: arXiv:2012.15431v5 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We explain why the naive definition of a natural exact category structure on complete, separated topological vector spaces with linear topology fails. In particular, contrary to arXiv:0711.2527, the category of such topological vector spaces is not quasi-abelian. We present a corrected definition of exact category structure which works OK. Then we explain that the corrected definition still has a shortcoming in that a natural tensor product functor is not exact in it, and discuss ways to refine the exact category structure so as to make the tensor product functors exact.
item.dc:creator: Leonid Positselski

item.title: Kripke-Joyal forcing for type theory and uniform fibrations
item.description: arXiv:2110.14576v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We introduce a new method for precisely relating certain kinds of algebraic structures in a presheaf category and judgements of its internal type theory. The method provides a systematic way to organise complex diagrammatic reasoning and generalises the well-known Kripke-Joyal forcing for logic. As an application, we prove several properties of algebraic weak factorisation systems considered in Homotopy Type Theory.
item.dc:creator: S. Awodey, N. Gambino, S. Hazratpour

item.title: The moment problem for random objects in a category
item.description: arXiv:2210.06279v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: The moment problem in probability theory asks for criteria for when there exists a unique measure with a given tuple of moments. We study a variant of this problem for random objects in a category, where a moment is given by the average number of epimorphisms to a fixed object. When the moments do not grow too fast, we give a necessary and sufficient condition for existence of a distribution with those moments, show that a unique such measure exists, give formulas for the measure in terms of the moments, and prove that measures with those limiting moments approach that particular measure. Our result applies to categories satisfying some finiteness conditions and a condition that gives an analog of the second isomorphism theorem, including the categories of finite groups, finite modules, finite rings, as well as many variations of these categories. This work is motivated by the non-abelian Cohen-Lenstra-Martinet program in number theory, which aims to calculate the distribution of random profinite groups arising as Galois groups of maximal unramified extensions of random number fields.
item.dc:creator: Will Sawin, Melanie Matchett Wood
